subject: Ethics
title: Geoengineering Moral Hazards
description: A micro-lesson that makes Geoengineering Moral Hazards usable.

hook.text: What if we could cool the planet by spraying chemicals into the sky? Some scientists say we should try.

buildup.text: Solar geoengineering would reflect sunlight back into space, potentially lowering global temperatures fast.

discovery.text: It's technically possible and cheap compared to cutting emissions. That's exactly what makes it dangerous.

twist.text: If nations believe a quick fix exists, they'll have less incentive to actually reduce emissions.

climax.text: One country's thermostat could become another country's drought. Who gets to control Earth's climate?

punchline.text: A global Band-Aid with no one's permission needed.

quiz.question: What is the 'moral hazard' of geoengineering?
options: Geoengineering technology is far too expensive to ever develop
It could reduce motivation to cut emissions by offering a seemingly easy alternative
Geoengineering would instantly solve all climate problems
